heading: Today
text: Any snow showers northeast ending.  Mostly sunny south, and from NY north to Montreal, while clouds northeast giving way to sunshine.  Much colder.  Temperatures in the upper single numbers and teens north, 20 to 25 south, steady or falling.  Winds northwest 10 to 15 mph, gusting to 25 mph from the Green Mountains east, near 10 mph west, diminishing in the afternoon.

heading: Tonight
text: Clear and cold, with some high clouds in the St. Lawrence late.  Lows zero to 10 below, some teens below northeast.  Winds light, turning to the southwest near 10 mph through NY and the St. Lawrence after midnight.

heading: Tuesday
text: Some morning sun, giving way to increasing clouds.  Not as cold.  Highs in the upper teens to low 20s north, in the 20s in the Champlain and St. Lawrence Valleys, and south.  Winds becoming south near 10 mph east, and 10 to 15 mph from the Green Mountains west, gusting 20 to 30 mph.
